intro: Odontites viscosus var. commutatus, commonly known as the sticky bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its sticky secretions on the leaves and stems are a distinctive botanical feature.
